title: Evaporative Loss Control System – Certain Markets Only

body.body: Evaporative Loss Control System – Certain Markets Only
Some models in certain markets are fitted with a system to control the evaporation of fuel vapour to the atmosphere.
A carbon filled evaporative canister absorbs vapour while the engine is not running. When the engine is started, the vapour is returned to the engine and burned.
There are two distinct phases to the system's operation; engine off and engine running. These two conditions are explained overleaf.
Evaporative Canister - under the engine, in front of the sump cover.
Purge Control Valve - (electronically controlled by the engine ECM) in front of the sump cover, attached to the coolant expansion tank bracket.
